speaker: Emma
text: Hey Jake, I just finished reviewing your PR. The UI updates look really clean and much smoother than the previous version.
ipa: heɪ ʤeɪk | aɪ ʤəst ˈfɪnɪʃt rɪˈvjuːɪŋ jʊr piː ɑr | ðə ˌjuː ˈaɪ ˈʌpˌdeɪts lʊk ˈrɪəli kliːn ənd mʌʧ ˈsmuːðɚ ðən ðə ˈpriːviəs ˈvɝʒən
stress: HEY JAKE | I JUST FINISHED REVIEWING YOUR PR | THE UI UPDATES LOOK REALLY CLEAN AND MUCH SMOOTHER THAN THE PREVIOUS VERSION
linking:
"just finished" → /ʤəst ˈfɪnɪʃt/ (t links into f)
"reviewing your" → /rɪˈvjuːɪŋ jʊr/ (g links into y)
"updates look" → /ˈʌpˌdeɪts lʊk/ (s links into l)

speaker: Jake
text: Thanks! I tried to keep things as simple as possible. I also made the animations slightly faster so they feel more responsive.
ipa: θæŋks | aɪ traɪd tə kiːp θɪŋz əz ˈsɪmpəl əz ˈpɑsəbəl | aɪ ˈɔlsoʊ meɪd ði ˌænəˈmeɪʃənz ˈslaɪtli ˈfæstɚ soʊ ðeɪ fiːl mɔr rɪˈspɑnsɪv
stress: THANKS | I TRIED TO KEEP THINGS AS SIMPLE AS POSSIBLE | I ALSO MADE THE ANIMATIONS SLIGHTLY FASTER SO THEY FEEL MORE RESPONSIVE
linking:
"tried to" → /traɪd tə/ (d links into t)
"as simple as" → /əz ˈsɪmpəl əz/ (z links into s)
"feel more" → /fiːl mɔr/ (l links into m)

speaker: Emma
text: Yeah, the transitions are definitely smoother now. The old ones were a bit choppy, especially on slower devices.
ipa: jæ | ðə trænˈzɪʃənz ɑr ˈdɛfənətli ˈsmuːðɚ naʊ | ði oʊld wʌnz wɚ ə bɪt ˈʧɑpi | əˈspɛʃəli ɑn ˈsloʊɚ dɪˈvaɪsɪz
stress: YEAH | THE TRANSITIONS ARE DEFINITELY SMOOTHER NOW | THE OLD ONES WERE A BIT CHOPPY | ESPECIALLY ON SLOWER DEVICES

"bit choppy" → /bɪt ˈʧɑpi/ (t links into ch)

speaker: Jake
text: I ran some tests on mobile too. The performance is significantly better — loading times are now under two seconds.
ipa: aɪ ræn səm tɛsts ɑn ˈmoʊˌbaɪl tuː | ðə pɚˈfɔrməns ɪz sɪɡˈnɪfəkəntli ˈbɛtɚ — ˈloʊdɪŋ taɪmz ɑr naʊ ˈʌndɚ tuː ˈsɛkəndz
stress: I RAN SOME TESTS ON MOBILE TOO | THE PERFORMANCE IS SIGNIFICANTLY BETTER — LOADING TIMES ARE NOW UNDER TWO SECONDS
linking:
"tests on" → /tɛsts ɑn/ (s links into o)
"loading times" → /ˈloʊdɪŋ taɪmz/ (g links into t)

speaker: Emma
text: That’s impressive! Mine still loads a little slower, probably because I’m using heavier components.
ipa: ðæts ɪmˈprɛsɪv | maɪn stɪl loʊdz ə ˈlɪtl ˈsloʊɚ | ˈprɑbəbli bɪˈkəz aɪm ˈjuːzɪŋ ˈhɛviɚ kəmˈpoʊnənts
stress: THAT’S IMPRESSIVE | MINE STILL LOADS A LITTLE SLOWER | PROBABLY BECAUSE I’M USING HEAVIER COMPONENTS

"using heavier" → /ˈjuːzɪŋ ˈhɛviɚ/ (g links into h)

speaker: Jake
text: You could try switching to the lightweight version of the chart library. It’s less powerful, but much faster.
ipa: ju kəd traɪ ˈswɪʧɪŋ tə ðə ˈlaɪtˌweɪt ˈvɝʒən əv ðə ʧɑrt ˈlaɪˌbrɛri | ɪts lɛs ˈpaʊɚfəl | bət mʌʧ ˈfæstɚ

linking:
"switching to" → /ˈswɪʧɪŋ tə/ (g links into t)
"much faster" → /mʌʧ ˈfæstɚ/ (ch links into f)

speaker: Emma
text: Good idea. I also noticed your CSS is more organized now. How did you manage that?

speaker: Jake
text: I followed a utility-first approach and removed redundant styles. It’s definitely easier to maintain now.
ipa: aɪ ˈfɑloʊd ə juˈtɪləti fɝst əˈproʊʧ ənd rɪˈmuːvd rɪˈdʌndənt staɪlz | ɪts ˈdɛfənətli ˈiːziɚ tə meɪnˈteɪn naʊ

speaker: Emma
text: I like it! Honestly, this is one of your best pull requests — cleaner, faster, and more readable.

speaker: Jake
